Package com.unitedbankingservices.banknote

Class BanknoteInsertionSlot

java.lang.Object
com.unitedbankingservices.AbstractDevice<BanknoteInsertionSlotObserver>
com.unitedbankingservices.banknote.BanknoteInsertionSlot
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDevice<BanknoteInsertionSlotObserver>, PassiveSource<Banknote>, Sink<Banknote>
public final class BanknoteInsertionSlot extends AbstractDevice<BanknoteInsertionSlotObserver> implements Sink<Banknote>, PassiveSource<Banknote>
Represents a simple banknote slot device that can either accept a banknote or eject the most recently inserted banknote, leaving it dangling until the customer removes it, via removeDanglingBanknote().

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • receive

      public void receive(Banknote banknote) throws DisabledException, TooMuchCashException
      Tells the banknote slot that the indicated banknote is being inserted. If the sink can accept the banknote, the banknote is passed to the sink and a "banknoteInserted" event is announced; otherwise, a "banknoteEjected" event is announced, meaning that the banknote is returned to the user. Requires power.
      Specified by:
      receive in interface Sink<Banknote>
      Parameters:
      banknote - The banknote to be added. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      DisabledException - if the banknote slot is currently disabled.
      SimulationException - If the banknote is null.
      TooMuchCashException - If a banknote is dangling from the slot.

    • emit

      public void emit(Banknote banknote) throws DisabledException
      Ejects the indicated banknote, leaving it dangling until the customer grabs it. Requires power.
      Parameters:
      banknote - The banknote to be ejected.
      Throws:
      DisabledException - If the device is disabled.
      SimulationException - If the argument is null.
      DeviceFailureException - If a banknote is already dangling from the slot.

    • reject

      public void reject(Banknote banknote)
      Description copied from interface: PassiveSource
      Allows a device to reject an item of cash, forcing it back to the source. Not all passive sources may support this. Requires power.
      Specified by:
      reject in interface PassiveSource<Banknote>
      Parameters:
      banknote - The item of cash to reject.

    • removeDanglingBanknote

      public Banknote removeDanglingBanknote()
      Simulates the user removing a banknote that is dangling from the slot. Announces "banknoteRemoved" event. Disabling has no effect on this method. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      The formerly dangling banknote.

    • hasDanglingBanknotes

      public boolean hasDanglingBanknotes()
      Determines whether this slot has a banknote dangling from it. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      true if there is a dangling banknote; otherwise, false.

    • hasSpace

      public boolean hasSpace()
      Tests whether a banknote can be accepted by or ejected from this slot. Disabling has no effect on this method. Requires power.
      Specified by:
      hasSpace in interface Sink<Banknote>
      Returns:
      True if the slot is not occupied by a dangling banknote; otherwise, false.
